intro: Cordula glaucophylla, commonly known as the blue-leafed cordula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
